condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 3.3 The education system is strengthened to promote peace, reconciliation and resilience among adolescent girls and boys.

description.narrative: UNICEF continues to promote peace, social cohesion and reconciliation through strengthening systems and building life skills among adolescents, with a focus on operationalizing policies/action plans, supporting curriculum reforms to integrate skilling, and promoting co-curricular activities and conducive environments in schools. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:25/08/2020

title.narrative: National Action Plan on Education for Peace and Reconciliation developed and implemented

actual.value: 2019:Interventions under the Action Plan has been partially implemented. The progress has been slow due to frequent change of key technical staff and lack of capacity at the Peace Education and Reconciliation Unit, MoE. UNICEF has initiated discussions with the newly appointed staff and a steering com

title.narrative: System Strengthening - Skills - Community engagement support the mainstreaming of skills development within the national system - score (1-4), see guidance

baseline.value: Score 2: Community engagement. In relevant areas (where there are community structures), only a few communities are engaged in supporting the coordination or delivery of formal and non-formal or informal skills development programs (e.g. apprenticeship or firm-based training) or they are engaged in a very limited manner.

actual.value: 2019:Score 2: Community mobilization towards skills development has not yet begun, although demand creation is incorporated into relevant programme designs

title.narrative: System Strengthening - Skills - National curricula and training support the mainstreaming of skills development within the national system - score (1-4), see guidance

baseline.value: Score 2: Curricula and training. The skills needed for at least two of the following objectives: learning, personal empowerment, employability and active citizenship are integrated in national curricula and are delivered through one of the following: curricular, co-curricular and extra-curricular approaches. There is no assessment of skills. These skills are not or only very partially part of teacher pre-service training. Only limited guidance and/or in-service teacher training opportunities are
